A absolutley fun and casaul version of the toxic and salty game CS:GO. imagine a less bettor lookiing and wierd interface of CS:GO but its more fun less stress inducing NO 7 day for just playing the damn game.
10/10

Can't recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a decent shooter. The lack of support for this game is very evident with how bad some of the weapons are, and horrible level design in how some teams have better odds on certain maps. If you think you know how to aim a weapon in an FPS you are wrong in this game. Recoil is done in the most ridiculous fashion in that there is no visual feedback as to where your bullets go. Getting used to aiming in this game is not something I was willing to do. Still cannot do it, it goes against every gamer instinct I've had.

These are among the most innacurate weapons I've ever seen in a video game. I go down to a firing range and unload a whole clip which is more accurate than any spread I've shot in this game. Chances are, if you have your enemy in your crosshair, you are missing 90% of shots.

Not as if it matters, its a Valve game so it gets a write-off for everything negative for some magic reason. A game published by valve will always be among top ratings even though every game they make has something absolutely horrible and unforgivable in it that could be easily fixed with some TLC. Valve clearly doesn't want to make video games anymore. Only to cash in on the MLG crowd by putting out CSGO, a carbon copy of this game down to the core with improved graphics.

CSS makes a decent game to screw around in for about 20 minutes though. Listening to morons talking on their mics about dumb garbage can be somewhat enlightening until you realise how many through wall headshot deaths you have suffered during the rounds. There's not many servers around to help you improve your game, everyone has sunk in thousands of hours already. I cannot find a server anywhere to improve my skills in this game and I've spent 51 hours as of this review. I always get picked about .1 to .2 seconds after rounding a corner in the majority of servers available.

So yes, this review is because I suck at the game and think its a waste of time. But not because im frustrated with myself, but the game itself. Theres never anyone playing around my skill level, so how can I enjoy the game any more than not at all. I'd like to get better but alas cannot, which deters me from purchasing CSGO. Why would I spend money on another counter strike game with this as my experience.

Still the best. 
Still better than COD.

First CS ever played back in 2009 and it still the way it is now :D

Enjoyment of this game has deteriorated over time due to the local community servers that are populated. Internet connectivity to these servers gets interrupted specifically (internet outside of server still works fine). This results in issues such as: bullet damage inconsistency, movement rubber banding and other issues similar (gameplay altering).  In conclusion: fun game to play as a lan, not fun while playing on local community servers (Australian located).

One of the classic steam games, this game got me onto steam along with half life. This game may be outdated, but every now and then I go back to play this as it never disapoints. This gives a good break from CS:GO, if you have played CS:GO Competitive for awhile you probably know what I'm talking about, other than that it's a great game.
